Notes.Text:
socat was updated 1.7.2.4 to fix one security issue and bugs.

The following vulnerabilities were fixed:

* socats PROXY-CONNECT address was vulnerable to a buffer overflow with data from command line (CVE-2014-0019, boo#860991)

The following bugs were fixed:

* socat would frequently crash on  ppc and armv7l (boo#927161)
* various other bug fixes in 1.7.2.4
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in socat 1.3.0.0 through 1.7.2.2 and 2.0.0-b1 through 2.0.0-b6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a long server name in the PROXY-CONNECT address in the command line.
